## Description {#details}

An ilist node that can access its parent list.

Requires <code>NodeTy</code> to have <em><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/ilist-detail/node-parent-access/#a7e19e7508415378ad9523e0339b23e22">getParent()</a></em> to find the parent node, and the <code>ParentTy</code> to have <em>getSublistAccess()</em> to get a reference to the list.

Definition at line 321 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/ilist-node-h">ilist&#95;node.h</a>.

## Private Member Functions

### getNodeParent() {#a31a823b492711c44518361f865cf8061}

<MemberDefinition
  template={<>template &lt;typename NodeTy, typename ParentTy, class... Options&gt;</>}
  prototype={<>const ParentTy &#42; llvm::ilist&#95;node&#95;with&#95;parent&lt; NodeTy, ParentTy, Options &gt;::getNodeParent () const</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Forward to NodeTy::getParent().

Note: do not use the name &quot;getParent()&quot;. We want a compile error (instead of recursion) when the subclass fails to implement <em><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/ilist-detail/node-parent-access/#a7e19e7508415378ad9523e0339b23e22">getParent()</a></em>.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/ilist-node-h/#l00331">331</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/ilist-node-h">ilist&#95;node.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>
